intro: Chascanum yemenense, commonly known as Yemen chascanum, is a flowering plant native to the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which includes many succulent species adapted to arid environments. The plant features fleshy, cylindrical stems and produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange. It is often found in rocky habitats and is well-suited for xerophytic conditions. Due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance, it is cultivated in some regions as a decorative plant.
